title: Financial Performance of Bunge Global SA

content.text: Bunge Global SA has experienced consistent revenue growth over the past five years. In 2016, the company reported revenue of $42.85 billion, which increased to $45.79 billion in 2017 and reached $46.92 billion in 2018. However, there was a slight decline in 2019, with revenue totaling $45.74 billion. Despite this dip, the company recovered in 2020, reporting revenue of $47.47 billion.

The earnings of Bunge Global SA have been more volatile compared to its revenue. In 2016, the company reported earnings of $745 million, which increased to $981 million in 2017. However, there was a significant decrease in earnings in 2018, with the company only making $153 million. In 2019, the earnings improved to $329 million. In 2020, Bunge Global SA reported earnings of $481 million.

Bunge Global SA has maintained positive cash flow in recent years. In 2016, the company reported cash flow from operating activities of $691 million, which increased to $970 million in 2017. The cash flow remained stable in 2018 at $965 million. In 2019, the cash flow improved to $1.23 billion. Bunge Global SA maintained positive cash flow in 2020 as well, reporting $1.17 billion.

news.headline: Insider Sale: Co-President of Agribusiness at Bunge Global SA Sells 20,000 Shares
news.summary: Christos Dimopoulos, Co-President of Agribusiness at Bunge Global SA (NYSE:BG), sold 20,000 shares of the company on May 22, 2024, according to a recent SEC Filing.
